questions.text: Two vertices of a triangle ABC are A(3, –1) and B (–2, 3), and its orthocentre is P(1, 1). If the coordinates of the point C are (, ) and the centre of the circle circumscribing the triangle PAB is (h, k), then the value of ( + ) + 2 (h + k) equals : (1) 51 (2) 81 (3) 5 (4) 15
